poem:
"Gone without Trace on Symi Breath"

Dappled sunlight meets the azure shore,
Sunset - the last echo of his smile.
Dr. Mosley, one with the island's lore,
His voice absent from the dawn's dial.

Agios Nikolaos, veiled in mystery,
A strange quiet swirls in your sigh.
His footprints fading, like a whispered poetry,
In curvatures of time, lost under Symi sky.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Michael Mosley search: what we know so far The search for British TV doctor Michael Mosley, known for popularising the 5:2 diet and for his appearances on The One Show and This Morning, is in its fourth day after he went missing on the Greek island of Symi on Wednesday afternoon. Here is what we know so far: Mosley, 67, was last seen leaving Agios Nikolaos beach, where he had been with his wife, Dr". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
